1: God whom I praise, do not be silent,\q
2:
For the wicked and deceitful attack me;\q they speak lies against me.
\q
3:
They surround me and say hateful things,\q and they attack me without cause.


\q
4:
In return for my love they slander me,\q but I pray for them.
\q
5:
They repay me evil for good,\q and they hate my love.


\q
6:
Appoint a wicked man over such an enemy as these people;\q appoint an accuser to stand at his right hand.
\q
7:
When he is judged, may he be found guilty;\q may his prayer be considered sinful.


\q
8:
May his days be few;\q may another take his office.
\q
9:
May his children be fatherless,\q and may his wife be a widow.
\q
10:
May his children wander about and beg,\q asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.


\q
11:
May the creditor take all he owns;\q may strangers plunder what he earns.
\q
12:
May no one extend any kindness to him;\q may no one have pity on his fatherless children.
\q
13:
May his children be cut off;\q may their name be blotted out in the next generation.


\q
14:
May his ancestors' sins be mentioned to Yahweh;\q and may the sin of his mother not be forgotten.
\q
15:
May their guilt always be before Yahweh;\q may Yahweh cut off their memory from the earth.
\q
16:
May Yahweh do this because this man never bothered to show any covenant faithfulness,\q but instead harassed the oppressed, the needy,
\q and the disheartened to death.


\q
17:
He loved cursing; may it come back upon him.\q He hated blessing; may no blessing come to him.
\q
18:
He clothed himself with cursing as his garment,\q and his curse came into his inner being like water,
\q like oil into his bones.


\q
19:
May his curses be to him like the clothes he wears to cover himself,\q like the belt he always wears.
\q
20:
May this be the reward of my accusers from Yahweh,\q of those who say evil things about me.


\q
21:
Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name's sake.\q Because your covenant faithfulness is good, save me.
\q
22:
For I am oppressed and needy,\q and my heart is wounded within me.
\q
23:
I am fading away like the shadow of the evening;\q I am shaken off like a locust.


\q
24:
My knees are weak from fasting;\q I am turning to skin and bones.
\q
25:
I am disdained by my accusers;\q when they see me, they shake their heads.


\q
26:
Help me, Yahweh my God;\q save me by your covenant faithfulness.
\q
27:
May they know that this is your doing,\q that you, Yahweh, have done this.


\q
28:
Though they curse me, please bless me;\q when they attack, may they be put to shame,
\q but may your servant rejoice.
\q
29:
May my adversaries be clothed with shame;\q may they wear their shame like a robe.


\q
30:
With my mouth I give great thanks to Yahweh;\q I will praise him in the midst of a crowd.
\q
31: For he will stand at the right hand of the one who is needy,\q to save him from those who judge him.
